definition: words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
words/speech/to say/to talk
as if/(just) like/just as/still/yet
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: The mild criticisms of Singapore by Guangzhou mayor Lin Shusen some months ago are still fresh in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 廣州市長林樹森幾個月前對新加坡的微詞言猶在耳。

sentences.english: Mind, passage of time, still ringing in our ears.
sentences.chinese: 物換星移，時過境遷，言猶在耳。

definition: to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
long-cherished wish
to be reluctant to give up a post
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
isolated/solitary
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
insignificant soldier (idiom)/a nobody/nonentity
feast/celebration
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
knell
commendation speech/eulogy/ode
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
